oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Design optimization of ZVS and ZCS quasi-resonant converters for EMI reduction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JOSHI, MADHUWANTI
AGARWAL, VIVEK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: spice
circuit analysis computing
circuit optimisation
circuit resonance
electromagnetic interference
interference suppression
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Quasi-resonant (QR) full-wave converters are known to offer inherent load insensitivity. This feature can be used to optimize the design of QR converters or reduce EMI. Step-by-step details of this optimization and relevant results of the analysis are presented. Zero-current-switched (ZCS) and zero-voltage-switched (ZVS) converters have been simulated using PSPICE and the EMI performance is investigated. The results show a significant reduction in EMI when optimized resonant tank components are used
